snippet.title: Road death jury struggle to reach verdict
snippet.content: A jury has indicated it is struggling to reach a verdict in the trial of a New Zealand father of three charged over the death of a man on a busy Queensland motorway in 2015. Tamate Henry Heke is fighting allegations he unlawfully killed Shane Merrigan by punching the 50-year-old before he was fatally hit by a rubbish truck on the Gateway Motorway in December 2015. A Brisbane Supreme Court jury retired shortly before 11am on Friday to commence deliberations but indicated via a note at 12.30pm on Monday they had reached an "impasse". (C) AAP 2017
